channel.title: BETTERSQUASH
channel.description: If you are looking to improve your squash, you have visited the right website!

item.title: Better Than Nothing - Why Even Doing 5 Minutes Solo Drilling Is Worth It
item.description: If you want to improve, you have to practice. The more, the better - more or less. But what's the minimum that will make a difference?
item.author: Phillip Marlowe

item.title: The Three Stages Of Using A Red Dot Squash Ball
item.description: You probably think that using a red dot squash ball is easy. Well, it is, then it isn't and then it is again! Confused? Read on.
item.author: Phillip Marlowe

item.title: Which Ball Should you use when Solo Drilling?
item.description: Using the right squash ball at the right time is essential to ensure you maximise your time on a squash court AND make sure you have as much fun as possible.
item.author: Phillip Marlowe

item.title: 3 Potentially Unpopular Opinions About Current Squash
item.description: In this short article, I talk about the Service Line, Diving and Foot Faults, and propose my solutions for the problems I believe they create.
item.author: Phillip Marlowe

item.title: Rackets Do Not Win Matches, Brains And Skill Do
item.description: Too many amateurs spend too much time, effort and energy worrying about equipment, when they should be focused on improving some aspect of their game.
item.author: Phillip Marlowe

item.title: Why Do You Play Better Squash When People Are Watching You?
item.description: If you are the type of person who does perform better with an audience, then try to imagine people watching when there aren’t any.
item.author: Phillip Marlowe

item.title: Dispelling Some Misconceptions About Squash
item.description: Ask non-squash playing people what they think, believe or have heard about squash and you will hear some of the misconceptions listed below.
item.author: Phillip Marlowe

item.title: Are You Thinking Short-Term Or Long-Term?
item.description: Want to win a particular match? Think short-term. Want to consistently improve? Think long-term. Let's explore the difference.
item.author: Phillip Marlowe

item.title: Set The Tone Of The Match From The First Rally
item.description: Have you ever played somebody who gave 100% from the very first point and who also was so focused that it was a little intimidating? Well, that could be you.
item.author: Phillip Marlowe

item.title: 5 Dead Ball Drills To Improve Your Accuracy
item.description: Hitting the ball non-stop is great, but sometimes simply dropping the ball and hitting it once can help us improve our accuracy. Let me show you 5 different drills to do just that.
item.author: Phillip Marlowe

item.title: The 5 Vs of Training: Volume, Velocity, Veracity, Variety & Value
item.description: In this article, I discuss how much training you should do, how fast you should do it, how *perfect* it should be, how many different exercises you should do and finally ensuring it's the right training for YOU.
item.author: Phillip Marlowe

item.title: Goldilocks Squash - Why Just Right Is Exactly As It Sounds!
item.description: There's a lot we can learn from a 190-year old nursery tale. Everything is about selecting just the right amount of something, be it power, speed, effort, excitement, because to put it bluntly: More is NOT always better.
item.author: Phillip Marlowe

item.title: Squash Rituals To Help You Play Better Squash
item.description: Having a custom that you follow before performing an important action can help reduce anxiety, focus your mind and improve performance. In this article, I discuss and explain some other ritual squash players perform.
item.author: Phillip Marlowe
